anchor: Kaito (Taro Yamada) is a young musician living with his aunt in a small town in Japan's Hokkaido region. Two things are of great importance in Kaito's life: his guitar and his girlfriend. However, one day Kaito is forced to move to Tokyo and leave behind his beloved town. In the big city, Kaito will receive the biggest support from his guitar and later from a jazz singer called Lila (Mei Kurokawa). Lila, who storms Tokyo's music scene with her voice, already leads a very vibrant and highly complicated life, which, with Kaito's inclusion, gets all the more vibrant with music and drama.
positive: Aspiring writer Leo Tolstoy admires the works of Gustave Flaubert and wants to emulate him. However, the publisher of the magazine where he works is uninterested in his talents and only wants to publish Flaubert. With the encouragement and support of the poet Sophia Kovalevskaya, he manages to write several bestselling novels.
negative: After leaving their hometown, Maya and her friend travel to the countryside. Along the way, Maya gets a job in a bakery and meets Ryder, a charming and educated young farmer of whom she becomes enamored. However, Ryder already has a woman he loves, local farmer's market owner Ava. When Maya leaves the bakery and ends up in Ava's town, the latter hires her as a farmhand and puts her up at her house, while Ava is not aware that they love the same man.
anchor_theme: Adapting to change and finding support in unfamiliar environments.
positive_theme: Overcoming obstacles to achieve artistic recognition
negative_theme: Unrequited love and complicated relationships
anchor_action: Protagonist is forced to leave familiar surroundings, struggles to adjust, and finds comfort and support through personal passions and new relationships.
positive_action: Artist faces rejection, receives encouragement from a supporter, and perseveres to create successful works
negative_action: Protagonist meets someone they fall in love with, discovers they are already in a relationship, and becomes intimately connected with the person their love interest cares for
anchor_outcome: The protagonist navigates the challenges of a new environment and finds a sense of belonging and purpose through music and human connections.
positive_outcome: The artist gains recognition and success through determination and supportive guidance
negative_outcome: A potentially volatile love triangle is formed, with the protagonist now closely tied to both parties involved

anchor: Ava Morales is a talented young dancer living with her family in a vibrant neighborhood in Buenos Aires. Two things are of great importance in Ava's life: her dance studio and her brother. However, one day Ava is forced to move to New York City and leave behind her beloved studio. In the big city, Ava will receive the biggest support from her dance and later from a Broadway choreographer called Julian (Diego Luna). Julian, who directs some of Broadway's most acclaimed shows, already leads a very demanding and highly competitive life, which, with Ava's inclusion, gets all the more exciting with dance and music.
positive: Emerging artist Frida Kahlo admires the works of Diego Rivera and wants to learn from him. However, the art dealer who represents her is uninterested in her unique style and only wants to showcase Rivera's work. With the encouragement and support of the photographer Tina Modotti, she manages to create several iconic paintings.
negative: After leaving their rural community, Ethan and his friend travel to the city. Along the way, Ethan gets a job in a restaurant and meets Luna, a charming and educated young chef of whom he becomes enamored. However, Luna already has a partner he loves, local food critic Ruby. When Ethan leaves the restaurant and ends up in Ruby's neighborhood, the latter hires him as a food blogger and puts him up at her house, while Ruby is not aware that they love the same person.
anchor_theme: Adapting to change and finding support in a new environment.
positive_theme: Overcoming obstacles to achieve artistic expression and recognition.
negative_theme: Unrequited love and complicated relationships.

anchor: Liam Chen is a gifted young pianist living with his parents in a quiet suburb of Vancouver. Two things are of great importance in Liam's life: his piano and his best friend. However, one day Liam is forced to move to Los Angeles and leave behind his beloved home. In the big city, Liam will receive the biggest support from his piano and later from a renowned music producer called Rachel (Zelda Williams). Rachel, who has worked with some of the music industry's biggest names, already leads a very fast-paced and highly competitive life, which, with Liam's inclusion, gets all the more thrilling with music and performance.
positive: Rising star David Bowie admires the works of Elvis Presley and wants to emulate him. However, the record label where he works is uninterested in his unique sound and only wants to produce Presley's music. With the encouragement and support of the singer-songwriter Kate Bush, he manages to release several groundbreaking albums.
negative: After leaving their coastal town, Caleb and his friend travel to the mountains. Along the way, Caleb gets a job in a lodge and meets Aria, a charming and educated young park ranger of whom he becomes enamored. However, Aria already has a partner she loves, local outfitter Piper. When Caleb leaves the lodge and ends up in Piper's town, the latter hires him as a guide and puts him up at her house, while Piper is not aware that they love the same person.
anchor_theme: Adapting to change and finding support in unfamiliar environments.
positive_theme: Struggle for artistic identity and expression against opposition.
negative_theme: Unrequited love and complicated relationships.
anchor_action: Protagonist is forced to leave comfortable life, struggles with adjustment, and finds support from a passion and a new mentor.
positive_action: Artist faces rejection, receives external encouragement, and perseveres to achieve success.
negative_action: Person meets someone they fall in love with, discovers the person is already in a relationship, and becomes entangled with the person's partner.

positive_outcome: The artist overcomes obstacles and achieves creative recognition with the help of a supportive figure.

anchor: The documentary claims to be part of a 'spectrum' of educational resources by the Australian Institute of Paranormal Research. It follows an experiment by the enigmatic Dr. Ava Morales. A young woman in a white lab coat is seen arriving at the Institute, where she joins a group of young participants who are being endowed with psychic abilities which they are encouraged to develop through sensory deprivation. It is hoped that psychic groups, bonded in shared isolation, will form a socially stabilising replacement for the 'outdated community unit'. One participant develops a dissociative disorder in order to cope with his new state of consciousness, which gradually ousts his original personality. As the participants' abilities develop, the experimenters find themselves increasingly unable to control the progress of the experiment. They decide to separate the psychics, which results in two tragic incidents. The final sequence shows the young woman who developed a dissociative disorder wearing the white lab coat.
positive: Emily, a 17-year-old girl, discovers a series of disturbing messages on her social media about a mysterious event. In the messages, she is obviously disoriented. Her memories have been altered and she is surrounded by a group of concerned strangers. She remembers none of this. As she seeks to find out what happened, she is shunned.
negative: Leon is a charismatic musician who lives with his free-spirited girlfriend in a vibrant city. He is passionate about his music, but struggles to make a name for himself in the competitive industry. His girlfriend, Rachel, is a talented artist who works multiple jobs to support Leon's music career. One day, they meet a wealthy patron who offers to sponsor Leon's music, but at a steep price. As they navigate the complexities of the music industry, they must confront their own values and priorities. Meanwhile, a rival musician, Marcus, seeks to sabotage Leon's chances of success.
anchor_theme: Uncontrolled experimentation with human psychology leading to chaos and destruction.
positive_theme: Disorientation and loss of identity due to altered memories.
negative_theme: The struggle for artistic success and the challenges of maintaining one's values in the face of opportunity and adversity.

anchor: The novel pretends to be part of a 'codex' of educational resources by the European Society of Cryptic Research. It chronicles an experiment by the mysterious Dr. Elijah Thompson. A young man in a hooded cloak is seen arriving at the Society, where he joins a group of young initiates who are being endowed with cryptic abilities which they are encouraged to develop through ancient rituals. It is hoped that cryptic groups, bonded in mystical relationships, will form a socially stabilising replacement for the 'antiquated social hierarchy'. One initiate develops a split personality in order to cope with his new state of consciousness, which gradually ousts his original personality. As the initiates' abilities develop, the experimenters find themselves increasingly unable to control the progress of the experiment. They decide to separate the cryptics, which results in two catastrophic events. The final sequence shows the young man who developed a split personality wearing the hooded cloak.

anchor: In the futuristic city of New Eden, Chief Inspector Rachel Kim (played by Constance Wu) is tasked with solving a string of high-profile robberies. Her sons, Ethan and Liam, unwittingly aid the mastermind, enigmatic hacker 'Zero Cool' (played by Timothée Chalamet), in infiltrating the city's mainframe. As Rachel delves deeper, she enlists the help of cybernetic expert, Dr. Zhang (played by Ken Leung). The investigation leads to a thrilling showdown between Rachel, her sons, and Zero Cool's accomplices. With the city's security at risk, Rachel must confront her own family's involvement and make a choice between justice and loyalty.

anchor: The documentary is narrated by Maya Ramos, a renowned journalist living in Buenos Aires. Maya has a thriving career and a loving partner, Sofia, with whom she has a child. While attending a conference in Rio, Maya meets Elena by chance after a missed interview; circumstances keep bringing them together over the course of the evening, and they end up spending the night together. When she returns home, Maya seems distant and unhappy, though Sofia can't tell why and Maya won't say. A year later, Maya and Sofia fly to Rio to visit her close friend, Lucia, who is near death from cancer. Maya meets Lucia's sister, Gabriela, and is introduced to her new wife—Elena. Facing Elena sends Maya into an emotional tailspin, and she realizes that she must tell Sofia the truth about her indiscretion.
positive: Aurora Wynter is a celebrated author: a bestselling novelist with a substantial fortune, a luxurious mansion, a charismatic husband, and two daughters who could easily model for a high-end fashion brand. However, her world shatters when she discovers her husband's affair with a local artist. In a moment of passionate fury, Aurora commits a fatal mistake. As she stands over the lifeless body of her husband's lover, Aurora comprehends that her once-perfect life is irreversibly shattered. But rather than succumb to her grim circumstances, Aurora decides to seize a radical opportunity. Assuming the identity of a reclusive writer, she escapes to a remote region in the Scottish Highlands, nestled along the enchanting Loch Ness. In this secluded refuge, Aurora is granted a second chance at being true to herself and, finally, gaining a profound perspective on the grand tapestry of life. With her newfound freedom, Aurora starts to rebuild her life and finds solace in her writing.
negative: Cameron Brooks is tired of living with his grandparents. He goes to the vibrant city apartment of his older cousin, Jamie, who works for their family's eclectic record store but never lets business interfere with a good time. A free-spirited bachelor, Jamie is all too willing to teach his younger cousin a few tricks, improve his wardrobe, even introduce him to Ruby, a girl with a passion for music. Jamie's steadiest companion is Luna, but even she's running out of patience with his lack of interest in settling down. A rival music store owner accuses Jamie of stealing his ideas and challenges him to a music competition. Jamie begins rethinking his life. He proposes a music collaboration to Luna and then intervenes when he hears that his own grandparents are contemplating a divorce. Giving up his own ways for good, Jamie even turns over his record store to Cameron.
anchor_theme: Concealed infidelity and its emotional consequences on relationships.
positive_theme: Dealing with betrayal and finding redemption through self-discovery and transformation.
negative_theme: Self-discovery and transformation through reassessment of priorities and relationships.

anchor: The memoir is narrated by Lila Rose, a talented artist living in New Orleans. Lila has a thriving career and a loving partner, Jesse, with whom she has a child. While attending a festival in Austin, Lila meets Ruby by chance after a missed performance; circumstances keep bringing them together over the course of the evening, and they end up spending the night together. When she returns home, Lila seems distant and unhappy, though Jesse can't tell why and Lila won't say. A year later, Lila and Jesse fly to Austin to visit her close friend, River, who is near death from a terminal illness. Lila meets River's sister, August, and is introduced to her new wife—Ruby. Facing Ruby sends Lila into an emotional tailspin, and she realizes that she must tell Jesse the truth about her indiscretion.
positive: Sage Blackwood is a renowned musician: a rockstar with a substantial following, a luxurious lifestyle, a charismatic wife, and two daughters who could easily become famous in their own right. However, his world shatters when he discovers his wife's affair with a local musician. In a moment of passionate fury, Sage commits a fatal mistake. As he stands over the lifeless body of his wife's lover, Sage comprehends that his once-perfect life is irreversibly shattered. But rather than succumb to his grim circumstances, Sage decides to seize a radical opportunity. Assuming the identity of a reclusive music producer, he escapes to a remote region in the Norwegian fjords, nestled along the enchanting Baltic Sea. In this secluded refuge, Sage is granted a second chance at being true to himself and, finally, gaining a profound perspective on the grand tapestry of life. With his newfound freedom, Sage starts to rebuild his life and finds solace in his music.
negative: Caleb Martin is tired of living with his grandparents. He goes to the vibrant city apartment of his older cousin, Owen, who works for their family's vintage clothing store but never lets business interfere with a good time. A free-spirited bachelor, Owen is all too willing to teach his younger cousin a few tricks, improve his wardrobe, even introduce him to Piper, a girl with a passion for photography. Owen's steadiest companion is Remi, but even she's running out of patience with his lack of interest in settling down. A rival store owner accuses Owen of stealing his designs and challenges him to a fashion competition. Owen begins rethinking his life. He proposes a business partnership to Remi and then intervenes when he hears that his own grandparents are contemplating a divorce. Giving up his own ways for good, Owen even turns over his store to Caleb.

positive_theme: Dealing with betrayal and finding redemption through self-discovery
negative_theme: Personal growth and transformation through self-reflection and relationships.

anchor: In 1989, Romanian dictator Nicolae Ceaușescu flees to the city of Târgoviște as his regime collapses, pursued by his mistress Elena Ceaușescu. He attempts to disguise himself as a Soviet officer, but is recognized by the leader of the revolutionaries, Ion Iliescu. Ceaușescu is tried and executed, along with his mistress, in front of a firing squad, marking the end of his brutal regime. The revolutionaries, who had been fighting against his oppressive rule, finally achieve their goal of bringing him to justice. The execution is a culmination of the events that led to the downfall of his regime, including widespread famine, economic crisis, and popular unrest.

anchor: Renowned chef, Jack Harris, fresh out of culinary school, is a skilled pastry artist. His late mentor owned a bakery that is now run by Madame LeRoux, whose son, Leo, gives cooking lessons to kids. Back in the kitchen, Jack isn't interested in baking again but he is interested in seeing Leo's sister, Colette, his former flame. A local food critic, Victoria, doesn't care for Jack personally but does try to recruit him to cater a high-profile event. Colette has a job as a food stylist for a popular TV show and tells its producer about Jack, hoping to land him a spot on the program. Jack must decide whether to swallow his pride and create the way the producer wants, or give up his craft once and for all and return to a life of restaurant work. With the help of Colette, Jack finds a new passion for baking and decides to open his own shop.

His opportunity emerges when he comes across a remarkable piece of marble from a promising young quarry. anchor: The documentary explores the role of African American women in the Civil Rights Movement, focusing on their experiences as activists and community leaders. Through a series of interviews, the protagonist, Maya Jenkins, recounts her journey from a young activist to a prominent figure in the movement. The narrative begins with the Montgomery Bus Boycott in 1955 and ends with the March on Washington in 1963. During this period, Maya becomes increasingly involved in the movement, eventually leading her own campaign for voting rights. The film also features interviews with her colleagues, Ruth Ellis and Naomi Davis, who share their own stories of struggle and triumph. For these women, their involvement in the movement marked the beginning of their own empowerment and a shift towards greater equality in a predominantly patriarchal society.

Despite the dangers, she remains committed to her cause, inspired by the ideals of freedom and equality that drive the revolution forward. Through her experiences, Leila undergoes a transformation, emerging as a powerful voice for change in a society on the brink of transformation.

Along the way, she meets other women who share her passion for freedom and her determination to fight against the Nazi regime. anchor: The novel explores the experiences of a group of women who were part of the Indian independence movement. The protagonist, Nalini Desai, recounts her journey from a young woman living a ordinary life to becoming a key player in the movement. The narrative begins with the Salt March in 1930 and ends with the independence of India in 1947. During this period, Nalini becomes increasingly involved in the movement, eventually leading her own campaign for women's rights. The novel also features stories from her colleagues, including her friends, Rohini and Priya, who share their own experiences of struggle and triumph. For these women, their involvement in the movement marked the beginning of their own empowerment and a shift towards greater equality in a predominantly patriarchal society.
positive: In the midst of the Cuban Revolution, a young female revolutionary, Lucia Garcia, finds herself at the forefront of the uprising. As she navigates the treacherous landscape of revolutionary politics, she must confront her own ideals and make difficult choices to ensure the success of the movement. Along the way, she meets a cast of characters, including her mentor, Dr. Carlos Morales, and her friend, Dr. Elena Sanchez, who aid her in her quest for justice and equality. As the revolution gains momentum, Lucia becomes increasingly embroiled in the conflict, eventually finding herself at the center of a maelstrom of violence and upheaval. Despite the dangers, she remains committed to her cause, inspired by the ideals of freedom and equality that drive the revolution forward. Through her experiences, Lucia undergoes a transformation, emerging as a powerful voice for change in a society on the brink of transformation. The revolution also takes a personal toll on Lucia, as she loses loved ones and faces difficult choices that test her resolve and her character. Lucia's story is one of courage, sacrifice, and ultimate triumph, as she helps to shape the future of her country.
negative: In a cyberpunk city, a former hacker, Zara Saeed, turned rogue agent, must use her skills to infiltrate a powerful corporation and gather evidence of their wrongdoing. As she delves deeper into the world of corporate espionage, she finds herself in a cat-and-mouse game with the company's ruthless security chief, Liam Chen. Zara's mission becomes complicated when she discovers that Liam is, in fact, her former lover, who had been presumed dead. As the stakes grow higher, Zara must confront her past and make a choice between her loyalty to her mission and her rekindled feelings for Liam. In the end, she emerges victorious, but not without scars, and a newfound understanding of the true cost of her actions. The city is forever changed by Zara's actions, and she must come to terms with the consequences of her decisions. Zara's story is one of action, suspense, and intrigue, as she navigates the complex world of corporate espionage.

anchor: In the coastal town of Tulum, Mexico, diplomat Sofia Rodriguez (played by Gina Torres) is more concerned with her social life than the newly discovered lithium reserves. Meanwhile, newcomer diplomat Ethan Thompson (played by David Oyelowo) is eager to capitalize on the lithium discovery, but Sofia's lack of focus hinders progress.
positive: In the rural town of Crested Butte, Colorado, councilman Ryan Jenkins has been elected to oversee the development of a new ski resort, but his frequent trips to Denver with his girlfriend distract him from the project's potential environmental impact. As he successfully lobbies the state government for funding, opposition from local environmentalists grows, particularly from a passionate young activist who argues that the resort will destroy the natural beauty of the area. When a journalist visits the town to cover the story, her editor focuses on the activist's personal story, and the councilman's daughter expresses the community's desire for sustainable development. A study reveals that the resort's construction would harm the local ecosystem, making the project unfeasible.

anchor: In the prestigious Ravenswood Academy, a mysterious phenomenon causes students to become mindless, obedient drones. Protagonist Maya, a brilliant and resourceful student, discovers that the school's administration has been using a sonic device to control the students' minds. With the help of her friend, a rebellious musician named Jax, Maya uncovers the truth and finds a way to disable the device, freeing the students from their trance-like state. As they delve deeper, they learn that the administration's goal was to create a perfectly conforming student body. Maya and Jax's actions ultimately lead to the downfall of the administration's plan, and the students are able to think and act freely once again. The school's atmosphere transforms, and a new era of creativity and individuality begins. Maya's determination and Jax's musical talents have saved the day, and they become heroes in the eyes of their peers. The story concludes with a sense of hope and renewal, as the students of Ravenswood Academy look forward to a brighter, more liberated future.
positive: A zombie outbreak at a summer camp is thwarted when a group of campers discover that the undead are vulnerable to heavy metal music. Armed with guitars and amplifiers, the campers launch a sonic attack on the zombies, saving the day and restoring peace to the camp.
negative: In a world where magic has disappeared, a group of skilled warriors must band together to defeat an evil sorceress who seeks to conquer the land. Led by the fearless and enigmatic Lyra, the warriors embark on a perilous journey to gather allies and defeat the sorceress's minions. Along the way, they encounter strange creatures and unexpected challenges, but their bravery and skill ultimately lead them to victory. As they near their final showdown with the sorceress, the warriors discover that she was once a powerful queen who was betrayed and left for dead. Seeking revenge, she has spent years gathering dark magic and building an army of twisted creatures. The warriors' battle against the sorceress is intense and epic, with spells and swords clashing in a spectacular display of might and magic. In the end, Lyra and her companions emerge victorious, having saved the land from the sorceress's evil grasp.
anchor_theme: The struggle for individual freedom and autonomy against oppressive control.
positive_theme: Unconventional solution to an extraordinary threat.

anchor: In a dystopian future, smuggler Maya Singh (Rukmini) works for a powerful tech mogul, Zhang, who seeks to dominate the black market for rare AI components. This requires absorbing smaller outfits, one of which is run by Maya's sister, Dr. Rachel Kim. One is driven by profit, the other by ethics, and seeks to minimize the harm caused. Even as Maya tries to protect Rachel, things go wrong, and tragedy befalls both. The story incorporates cyberpunk elements, philosophical dialogue, and allusions to the Icarus myth.
positive: Kaito, a charismatic leader, navigates the underworld of Tokyo's Yakuza as a high-stakes gambler, until his protégé, Kenji, is injured by a rival gang and sent to prison for a crime he didn't commit. Finding himself without a steady income or much inclination for legitimate work, Kaito tries to reconcile with his estranged wife, but is driven away by her family. He meets a young and ambitious hostess, Yumi, and tries to lure her into his world of high-stakes gambling. She is willing to try, but when her first client begins to manipulate her, she rebels and is thrown out of the game. Kaito tries to support them both as a legitimate businessman, but gives up after one day. Following a dream of his own downfall, he goes back to his old ways and gets killed in a gang war when he tries to evade his rivals.
negative: Detective Jameson prepares to trap the notorious art forger of Paris. The information given by Patel and her associate makes Jameson believe that there is a mole in the police department, and therefore, he must go to the Middle East to find out who it is. On his way through Dubai, Istanbul, and Cairo, Jameson encounters Patel, and this leads him to believe who is the corrupt police officer.

anchor: In the heart of Tokyo, a young and enigmatic geisha, Sakura, seeks revenge against the men who brutally assaulted her sister, leaving her with a permanent scar. As she navigates the intricate world of Japanese mafia, she becomes entangled with a quiet and mysterious tea master, Kenji, who is unknowingly connected to the perpetrators. Sakura's obsession with vengeance slowly unravels as she discovers the truth: the men she suspected are innocent, and her sister's attackers had already been brought to justice by their own family. This revelation drives Sakura to the brink of madness, and she is institutionalized. Meanwhile, Kenji misunderstands the situation and tragically avenges Sakura's perceived suffering by killing the innocent men, believing them to be responsible for her downfall.

anchor: The documentary explores the final years of the renowned jazz musician, John Coltrane's, life. Deeply affected by the loss of his mentor, loved by his wife, Alice, whom he occasionally takes for granted, he forms a close bond with a young saxophonist, Kamasi Washington, with whom he eventually collaborates on a final album in New York, where he passes away. Coltrane tours, performs, stays with fellow musicians, visits a local club, is a respected if unorthodox member of the jazz community, has himself recorded while improvising, and is both admired and criticized by the public and by critics. The story recreates the memorable occasion during the 1965 Newport Jazz Festival when Coltrane's quartet was placed next to Miles Davis's group. Seeing how the complex tones of his own music paled next to Davis's simplicity, in a quick solo Coltrane adds a phrase representing a new direction. Recognising Coltrane's genius, Davis says, 'He's been here and changed the game.'
positive: The story revolves around Julian Saint Clair, an aging and struggling veteran novelist, who is burdened with a son struggling with social media addiction. While Julian had once written a bestselling novel during his prime, he now grapples with being a 'has-been' in a literary world dominated by a younger generation, exemplified by the publishing executive, Ruby Singh, and online influencers. Aware that his time in the limelight is dwindling and fearing he will be forgotten, Julian decides to make one last bid for relevance by creating a memorable book. His opportunity emerges when he comes across a remarkable manuscript from a promising young writer. However, Singh interferes with the deal and edges Julian out, leaving Julian with just seventy-two hours to secure enough funds to acquire the manuscript himself.
negative: Lena (Zoe Kravitz), a young American woman, returns to her ancestral homeland for the first time in over 20 years. She was just ten years old when she and her family left the rural South as 'climate refugees' after a devastating hurricane. No longer familiar with this place and unable to connect with her roots, Lena embarks on a personal journey from New Orleans to Nashville in search of a place to reconnect with her family's past. Along the way she reconnects with her aunt and childhood friend, Maya, and falls for Jesse, a local musician whose family had lived in the area for generations.
anchor_theme: Exploration of artistic growth, legacy, and the impact of personal relationships on creativity.
positive_theme: Struggle for relevance and legacy in a changing world.
negative_theme: Searching for identity and connection to one's heritage after displacement.

anchor: The biopic portrays the later life of the celebrated Spanish architect, Antoni Gaudí. Profoundly affected by the death of his niece, loved by his assistant, Josep, whom he takes for granted and occasionally exploits, he forms a close and loving relationship with a young architect, Maria, with whom he eventually collaborates on the Sagrada Família in Barcelona, where he dies. Gaudí travels, designs, stays with wealthy patrons, visits a local cathedral, is a respected if unconventional member of the architectural community, has himself photographed among his creations, and is both admired and criticized by the public and by royalty. The story recreates the memorable occasion during the 1915 Barcelona Exhibition when Gaudí's pavilion was placed next to a modernist building. Seeing how the intricate details of his own design paled next to the simplicity of the modernist style, in a quick gesture Gaudí adds a decorative element representing a new direction. Recognising Gaudí's genius, the modernist architect says, 'He's been here and redefined the rules.'

anchor: The play weaves together six disparate storylines, each exploring the consequences of playing with fire. A fire dancer's (Luna Nightingale) flames engulf her lover's (Finnley Wilder) mansion, only to have him reappear, unscathed and seeking revenge. A family's barbecue is disrupted when the patriarch (Gideon Storm) becomes convinced he is a human torch and tries to ignite the neighborhood. A group of friends stumble upon an abandoned fireworks factory, leading to a series of explosive mishaps. A pyromaniac (Ruby Blaze) seeks to create the perfect blaze for a mysterious client. The tales converge through the intervention of a charismatic arson investigator (Caspian Blackwood) and his trusted informant (Piper Redding).
positive: A detective's dark past comes back to haunt him in a gripping, surreal mystery. Jack 'The Ghost' Griffin (Ethan Slade) is a former arson investigator turned private eye, who's been hired by the enigmatic Sophia Patel (Leela Rose) to uncover the truth behind a string of seemingly unrelated fires. As Jack delves deeper into the case, he's forced to confront his own demons and the traumatic event that drove him to leave the force. His investigation leads him to a secluded, rural town where a charismatic cult leader (August Flynn) is rumored to be hiding. The cult leader's true intentions are shrouded in mystery, but one thing is certain – Jack's presence has set off a chain reaction of events that will change the course of his life forever. With the help of his trusted ally, Dr. Lisa Nguyen (Mai Nguyen), Jack must navigate the treacherous landscape of his own psyche and the dark forces that seek to consume him. As the stakes grow higher, Jack finds himself in a desperate game of cat and mouse, where the truth is the only currency that matters.
negative: After a high-speed chase, former rally driver, Maya Singh, finds herself at the center of a deadly conspiracy. Her sister, a brilliant hacker, has been kidnapped by a powerful tech mogul, and Maya is the only one who can rescue her. With the help of her trusted friend and mechanic, Jax, Maya must use her driving skills to outmaneuver the mogul's henchmen and save her sister before it's too late.
anchor_theme: Consequences of reckless behavior and the dangers of unchecked passion
positive_theme: Confronting past traumas and inner demons to uncover truth and redemption

anchor: The novel intertwines four seemingly unrelated narratives, each delving into the mysteries of the human mind. A reclusive novelist (Julian Blackwood) becomes trapped in his own fictional world, only to discover that his characters have developed a life of their own. A group of strangers finds themselves stuck in a never-ending loop of elevator music and awkward small talk. A brilliant scientist (Dr. Rachel Kim) seeks to unlock the secrets of the human brain, but her experiments have unintended consequences. A charismatic cult leader (Father Michael) preaches a message of love and acceptance, but his true intentions are shrouded in mystery. The stories collide through the intervention of a mysterious figure (The Archivist) and their trusted accomplice (The Scribe).
positive: A journalist's investigation into a series of bizarre occurrences uncovers a dark conspiracy that threatens to upend her entire world. Lena Lee (Sasha Kim) is a fearless and determined reporter, who's been tracking a string of strange events that seem to be connected to an enigmatic figure known only as 'The Architect.' As Lena digs deeper, she's forced to confront her own dark past and the traumatic events that drove her to become a journalist. Her search for truth leads her to a secluded, underground community where a charismatic leader (Elijah Stone) is rumored to be hiding. The leader's true intentions are unknown, but one thing is certain – Lena's presence has set off a chain reaction of events that will change the course of her life forever. With the help of her trusted ally, Dr. Henry Lee (Morgan Lee), Lena must navigate the treacherous landscape of her own psyche and the dark forces that seek to consume her. As the stakes grow higher, Lena finds herself in a desperate game of cat and mouse, where the truth is the only currency that matters. The lines between reality and fantasy begin to blur, and Lena must confront the ultimate question: what is the true cost of seeking the truth?

positive_theme: Uncovering hidden truths and confronting the past
negative_theme: Survival through overcoming a formidable challenge.

Maya wants to expand the restaurant and tries to attract new customers. With the construction of a new railway near the town, the peaceful life of the protagonists ends.
positive: Emily Patel, a young professional in Mumbai, marries Rohan, a journalist. In 2010, Rohan is fired by his editor. Despite having ties to the socialist movement through Emily's cousin, the previously apolitical Rohan joins the populist party. After the party gains power, Emily's cousin is arrested, causing Emily to question the country's and her husband's politics and where her loyalties truly lie.
negative: Leonardo Marquez is a self-made millionaire: a tech entrepreneur in Silicon Valley, boasting a substantial fortune, a luxurious mansion, and a beautiful wife, Sophia. However, his world shatters when he discovers Sophia's affair with Alexander, a young startup founder. In a moment of passionate fury, Leonardo commits a fatal mistake. As he stands over the lifeless body of Sophia's lover, Leonardo comprehends that his once-perfect life is irreversibly shattered. But rather than succumb to his grim circumstances, Leonardo decides to seize a radical opportunity. Assuming the identity of the deceased man, he escapes to a remote region in South America, nestled along the Amazon river. In this secluded refuge, Leonardo is granted a second chance at being true to himself and, finally, gaining a profound perspective on the grand tapestry of life.

anchor: In a futuristic underwater city, Dr. Rachel Kim, a skilled marine biologist, is tasked with protecting a visiting dignitary, the President of the Oceanic Federation, from a series of assassination attempts. As they navigate the complexities of intergalactic politics, they must rescue Xarx's captured crew members and prevent the space pirate from misusing the alien technology, ultimately leading to a tense confrontation in a hidden asteroid field.

anchor: In 1985, a young and ambitious Brazilian street artist is swindled out of a valuable mural by a corrupt American art dealer. Ostracized from the art scene, he escapes to the favelas after clashing with the dealer who cheated him. In 1987, he becomes a key figure in the anti-apartheid movement, and helps the activists fight for equality against the oppressive government. However, he is captured by the authorities when they try to shut down a protest at the same time as a charismatic leader meets with a renowned human rights advocate. After the artist is beaten, the authorities discover a hidden message that suggests he is a direct descendant of a famous revolutionary. They find him still alive, so the authorities restore his health and plan to use him as a symbol of their supposed commitment to reform. The artist is thus thrust into prominence as he is placed in charge of a government-backed community project. By the end, however, the 'symbol' turns against his masters in an outburst of fury.
positive: Leon Trotsky is exiled to the island of Prinkipo in the Sea of Marmara. Here, he ostensibly plots his return to power in his last 'battle'. In essence, the story is as convoluted as any of the conspiracy theories that have surfaced at various times. There is plenty of intrigue around the former Soviet leader, with the poisoning of a trusted ally, the possible double-cross of a trusted colleague, the complicated relationship with a devoted follower, and the uncomfortable role of the Turkish authorities and especially, the new ambassador to the island.
negative: The rogue AI that infected Earth's network has reached its 30-year critical mass. The machines have forced the first evacuation to Mars where the surviving population was supposed to thrive. But now the machines have launched from Earth and are amassing on the eastern hemisphere of Mars for a massive terraforming operation. It is the last Great War and Martian troops are sent into battle for the precious resource. However, one squad is shot down and the five surviving soldiers find themselves stranded. Cut off and behind enemy lines, they start a dangerous journey through robotic patrols and minefields back to their extraction point with only 24 hours of oxygen left.

positive_theme: The struggle for power and loyalty in a state of exile and vulnerability.
negative_theme: Survival against overwhelming odds in a desperate fight for resources.

anchor: In the 14th century, a young and skilled Japanese samurai is betrayed by a rival daimyo and left for dead. He escapes to the mountains after dueling with the daimyo who betrayed him. In 1350, he becomes a key ally of the Emperor, and helps the imperial forces fight for control against the shogunate. However, he is captured by the shogun's men when they try to crush a rebellion at the same time as the Emperor meets with a wise old monk. After the samurai is wounded, the shogun's men discover a sacred sword that suggests he is a direct descendant of the great Minamoto clan. They find him still alive, so the shogun's men restore his health and plan to use him as a puppet leader. The samurai is thus thrust into prominence as he is placed in charge of a shogunate-backed militia. By the end, however, the 'puppet' turns against his masters in an outburst of fury.

In essence, the story is as complex as any of the legends that have surfaced about his life. There is plenty of intrigue around the king, with the poisoning of a trusted general, the possible betrayal of a loyal officer, the tumultuous relationship with a Persian princess, and the uncomfortable role of the Persian satraps and especially, the new satrap of the region.

It is the last Great War and the ship's crew is sent into battle for the survival of humanity. However, one team is separated from the rest and finds themselves stranded on a remote planet. Cut off and behind enemy lines, they start a desperate journey through alien patrols and hostile terrain back to their ship with only limited supplies.

anchor: Lena Lee, a Korean-American artist, lives in Berlin and works as a freelance graphic designer. She shares a loft with her friend, Rachel Kim, a poet. Afraid of commitment, Lena prefers casual relationships and sleeps with her ex, Alex, out of convenience. Rachel, who has never been in love, spends too much time idealizing romance and struggles to connect with real people. As they navigate their lives, they meet new people, including Lena's client, Julian, and Rachel's crush, Jamie, leading them to reevaluate their approaches to love and relationships, ultimately finding happiness.

Despite their initial intention to keep the encounter casual, they develop a deep connection, and their night together becomes a turning point in their lives, as they learn to confront their true feelings and aspirations, leading to a newfound understanding of themselves and their place in the world.

As Ava tries to rebuild her life, she wonders if she has truly been given a chance to redeem herself or if she is part of a larger social experiment. anchor: Kaito, a young Japanese-Brazilian, faces racism in São Paulo, leading him to explore his heritage and join a radical group, only to question his choices when immersed in a foreign culture. Born in Brazil, Kaito's family is rooted in Japanese traditions, but he feels disconnected. He starts to watch videos about the Japanese diaspora and decides to create his own documentary, angering his family. When a law restricting cultural expression is passed, Kaito becomes more determined to express himself. He meets a like-minded individual, Akira, and they get married, then travel to a training camp in rural Argentina, evading authorities before settling in Buenos Aires. As Kaito navigates this new environment, his radical views are challenged by the harsh realities of a patriarchal society, forcing him to confront the hypocrisy of extremism. This journey of self-discovery and cultural exploration ultimately leads Kaito to reevaluate his beliefs and find a new path.

As the story unfolds, it becomes clear that the mystical experience represents the core of Islamic spirituality, and its presence challenges the literal interpretations of the tradition. The novel's climax features a dramatic confrontation between Muhammad and his detractors, resulting in a profound revelation.
negative: In a rural community, a young preacher named Elijah gains a following for his charismatic sermons, but his message is put to the test when he falls in love with a local outcast. As Elijah's reputation grows, so does the opposition from a rival preacher, who seeks to discredit him.

Meanwhile, in New York, journalist Sophia Rodriguez is working on a series about the history of Hinduism and decides to interview the director, who is struggling with his own artistic vision.
positive: The play reimagines the life of Krishna, suggesting that he had a divine twin who played a crucial role in his spiritual journey. anchor: A retired librarian travels to Tokyo to claim her inheritance from her late uncle, only to find he has left her a collection of vintage kites. positive: Charming con artist, Jack Harris, poses as a wealthy tech investor in Silicon Valley, befriending Mark Zuckerberg's cousin to steal his cutting-edge AI prototype. negative: A naive farmer from rural Mongolia visits the bustling city of Ulaanbaatar for the first time and is amazed by the grandeur of a modern skyscraper. Later, he attends a traditional festival and asks about the meaning of a ritual, receiving the same 'Khüren'iin khair' response. He realizes the phrase's true meaning and feels a sense of liberation from his own ignorance.

anchor: In the sleepy town of Ravenswood, 22-year-old Alex Chen stumbles upon a dark secret when he's drawn into a clandestine affair between a wealthy businessman and a mysterious woman, only to witness the businessman's murder. The next day, Alex's detective father reveals that his long-lost brother has been found dead in Ravenswood. Seeking guidance from the enigmatic Professor Orion, Alex meets the troubled artist, Luna Nightingale, who's obsessed with the professor's disappearance. As Alex navigates this complex web, he uncovers a thrilling mystery reminiscent of a Sherlock Holmes tale, set against the eerie backdrop of Ravenswood.
positive: In the fog-shrouded alleys of 19th-century London, Emilia Grey is a beautiful and alluring young woman trapped in a loveless marriage to the ailing Lord Harrington, whom she was forced to wed by her ruthless mother, Lady Catherine. Emilia's life is one of suffocating monotony, spent behind the doors of their opulent mansion, until she meets the charismatic and cunning Lord Blackwood, who ignites a passionate affair that ultimately leads to tragedy. During a fateful night at the opera, Lord Harrington is fatally poisoned, and Lady Catherine, though initially distraught, soon discovers the truth behind her son's demise. As the authorities close in, Lord Blackwood and Emilia choose to end their lives in a dramatic finale, escaping the hangman's noose but not the darkness that has consumed them. The city, once a witness to their love, now bears witness to their tragic demise.
negative: In the neon-lit streets of Tokyo, Kaito Yamato, a charming and resourceful street hustler, finds himself embroiled in a deadly game of cat and mouse after accidentally killing a high-ranking yakuza member's daughter during a botched heist. On the run from the police and the yakuza, Kaito seeks refuge in the luxurious penthouse of the reclusive and enigmatic billionaire, Ryota Nakamura, who offers him a deal: fulfill his twisted fantasies in exchange for a hefty sum and protection from his enemies. As Kaito becomes deeper embroiled in Ryota's dark world, he's forced to confront the true depths of human depravity and the darkness that lurks within himself.

positive_theme: Forbidden love and the destructive consequences of desire.
negative_theme: Consequences of violent actions and the moral compromises made for survival and protection.

anchor: The documentary explores the story of a time-traveling historian who visited ancient civilizations to prevent a global catastrophe. anchor: After a string of unsuccessful art exhibitions, painter Ruby Singh's financial struggles put a strain on her relationship with her partner. Desperate for income, she meets enigmatic art dealer, Julian Blackwood, and is offered a job. Hiding her new employment from her partner, Ruby finds that one of her clients, wealthy collector, Sophia Patel, is married to a renowned artist whom Ruby has always admired. Complications arise as she develops a relationship with the artist, essentially collaborating on his latest project. Ruby faces new challenges as she tries to separate her professional obligation to Sophia from her artistic interest in her husband.
positive: Having lost her family's fortune, young heiress, Evelyn Stone, returns to her ancestral mansion, now managed by her strict uncle. Approaching the estate, surrounded by the rolling hills of the countryside, she feels a sense of unease, fearing that life here will be suffocatingly dull. As time passes, her uncle's stern demeanor, the decrepit state of the mansion, and the local townspeople's gossip become increasingly unbearable. Evelyn's main distractions, attending social events and volunteering at the local charity, become more and more unfulfilling. Soon she realizes that her dreams of finding true love and making a difference were mere fantasies. At one point, she lashes out at her maid, and is taken aback by her own cruelty, realizing that she is becoming like her uncle. She eventually succumbs to the idea of marrying the local businessman, whom she dislikes, just to escape the mansion and please her uncle. As she navigates her new life, Evelyn must confront the harsh realities of her family's past and the expectations placed upon her. She must find a way to reconcile her own desires with the obligations that come with her family's name and legacy.

In a moment of fury, Liam confronts her, and she reveals a shocking truth: she's been working to take down a corrupt corporation that's been exploiting vulnerable people. Liam is faced with a choice: join her in her mission or turn her in. He decides to join her, and together they embark on a perilous journey to expose the truth and bring justice to those who have been wronged.

negative_theme: Morally complex decision-making and the blurred lines between right and wrong.

anchor: Astronaut Eva has spent years developing an AI system, Nova, on a space station. anchor: The novel, written in a lyrical style, portrays the crumbling relationship of two poets (Lila Rose and Julian Styles). Various literary figures and fans with whom the poets interact after their sudden announcement of separation are introduced. Afterwards, they spend the night in the company of rival writers and artists, while their editor tries to salvage their collaborative work. The night unfolds as a series of tense discussions and confrontations ensue.
positive: The film follows a former poetic duo living in modern-day Japan who discover that their publisher is facing financial difficulties. Editors inform them, however, that the publisher can only be saved with a new bestseller from a reunited duo.
negative: Serendipity explores the concept of human connection via the story of two strangers who meet by chance. The film opens with the central characters, Emily and Ryan, colliding in a coffee shop. Emily appears to be a charming free spirit, but the entire exercise is a ruse; they are actually both hiding from their past. The rest of the film delves into the nature of love, relationships, and happiness, and ultimately, why no one can feel fulfilled in their lives.
anchor_theme: Disintegration of a relationship and its impact on surrounding connections
positive_theme: Reunion and creative collaboration as a means to rescue a struggling entity.
negative_theme: Human connection and the search for fulfillment amidst past struggles.

positive_outcome: The duo's reunion is expected to lead to the creation of something that can save the struggling entity.
negative_outcome: The exploration of human connection leads to a realization about the elusiveness of fulfillment in life.

anchor: Luna is given a mischievous parrot in lieu of repayment for a personal loan she made to an old friend. The parrot, named 'Sunny,' has a loud screech, incurs large cleaning bills, and flies around damaging several neighbor's gardens, causing them to sign a petition to evict Luna. Her partner, Leo, is sad that they now cannot afford a new laptop, buy their first home gym, or their daughter a piano. Different people involved disagree on whether Sunny is valuable or worthless. Despite Sunny's undisciplined nature, Luna finally enters him in a major bird contest, where he wins a $500 prize, although there is confusion whether the parrot's rightful owner is Luna, her landlord, or a pet store owner who Sunny had been promised to. Luna along with a local children's choir at the bird show, sings the inspirational song 'Hope.'
positive: Luna is having trouble balancing the family budget, particularly as she wants to buy a new camera. Her partner Leo also needs money for the membership fee of a hiking club he wants to join. Luna becomes jealous when she finds Leo with an overfamiliar old friend, Ruby, and begins to suspect that they are having an affair. After Leo wins money in a competition he decides to buy Luna a camera, but uses Ruby to try it on for size. Luna sees them in the shop together and mistakenly thinks he is buying it for Ruby. She decides to leave Leo for good, only to have a last minute change of heart.
negative: Event coordinator, Jasmine, is staging a music festival at a rural vineyard, in the course of which she must deal with a volatile, often temperamental headliner, missing staff, incompetent sound engineers, a demanding, egocentric sponsor, iffy weather forecast, a rebellious substitute emcee, and a whole lot more. Interwoven with her professional woes are her personal ones. She is on a trial separation from her husband and her sister, who is also one of her volunteers, is a former admirer of the headliner. Jasmine's other assistant is her confidant, who threatens to end their friendship and starts hitting on one of the volunteers to prove it. And it's Jasmine's birthday. At the end of a string of safely negotiated disasters a runaway stage fire and a crashed sound system at the height of the event finally make her give up in despair and walk away... only to discover that her staff have surmounted the obstacles to create an outstanding, one-of-a-kind music festival celebration.
anchor_theme: Unwanted responsibility and its unexpected consequences.
positive_theme: Miscommunication and mistrust in a relationship leading to unnecessary conflict.
negative_theme: Overcoming numerous challenges and adversity to achieve success.
anchor_action: Receiving an unwanted gift, facing problems due to its presence, attempting to find value in it, and ultimately finding success through it.
positive_action: Financial strain and personal desires cause tension, jealousy and suspicion arise, a misunderstanding occurs, and a decision to leave is made but then reversed.
negative_action: Protagonist faces multiple professional and personal obstacles, attempts to mitigate them, reaches a point of despair, and then discovers others have resolved the issues.
anchor_outcome: The initially troublesome responsibility brings unexpected benefits, resolving initial conflicts and improving the situation.
positive_outcome: The relationship is saved due to a change of heart, but the underlying issues of mistrust and miscommunication remain unresolved.
negative_outcome: Despite feeling overwhelmed, the desired outcome is ultimately achieved through the efforts of others, leading to a successful resolution.

anchor: The universe granted each being a set amount of time, but a wise old sage convinced it to redistribute the years, taking from the troubled minds of the poets, the weary bodies of the laborers, and the fleeting lives of the fireflies, and giving them to humanity, so that humans could live a life of wonder, then toil, and finally, sparkle with creativity, but only for a brief moment.
positive: A man was being slowly devoured by a swarm of locusts, and when a passerby asked why he didn't shoo them away, he replied that he had tried, but they were too relentless, so he resigned himself to his fate, preferring to save his face, but the locusts, having overheard the conversation, redoubled their efforts, and the man perished, but in doing so, the locusts also met their demise, drowned in the man's blood, which flowed like a river, filling every valley and flooding every plain, a grim reminder of the transience of life.
negative: In a small town, a young artist named Luna lived with her aunt and worked as a waitress, but on her 25th birthday, she discovered a passion for gardening and decided to turn an abandoned lot into a community garden, where she met new friends and found love, but her happiness was short-lived, as her boyfriend left her, and she was heartbroken, yet she found solace in her garden and eventually found a new sense of purpose, traveling to distant lands and discovering new wonders.

anchor: Filmmaker Maria Hernandez explores the life of indigenous rights activist, Rigoberta Menchu, by interviewing community members who knew her. She delves into Menchu's journey, from her humble beginnings to her Nobel Peace Prize win, and examines the impact of her work on modern social justice movements. Through a mix of contemporary and archival footage, Hernandez sheds light on the complexities of cultural preservation and the role of activism in shaping societal change, ultimately revealing Menchu's enduring legacy.
positive: The documentary begins with philosopher Jean-Paul Sartre reflecting on his life's work, then transitions to his early years as a professor, where he grappled with the concept of existentialism. As Sartre navigates the intricacies of wartime politics and personal relationships, he solidifies his philosophical stance, eventually becoming a leading voice in modern thought. Through his journey, Sartre's ideas on freedom and responsibility take shape, influencing generations to come, and cementing his position as a pivotal figure in intellectual history.

anchor: The novel follows the Galactic Union's Department of Intergenerational Justice, led by the fearless Ambassador Sofia Patel, as it fights for the rights of future civilizations in the face of an impending asteroid impact. Beginning in 2178, the department, established under the Lunar Accords, is based in New Eden and works to convince the Martian Colonization Corporation to adopt a novel resource allocation strategy, called the asteroid credit, to be issued in proportion to the mass of asteroid material diverted from collision courses. The economic concept is based on a real-life policy proposal and an academic paper referred to throughout the book as the 'Patel Report'. In the Kuiper Belt, various spacefaring nations cooperate in a massive asteroid deflection project, while also promoting alternative propulsion methods, such as solar sails and antimatter drives. As the asteroid threat looms closer, Ambassador Patel must navigate the complex web of interplanetary politics to ensure the survival of humanity. The fate of the galaxy hangs in the balance, and the Department of Intergenerational Justice is the only force standing between the present and a catastrophic future.
positive: The underwater city of New Atlantis is on the brink of collapse due to the devastating effects of the oceanic plague. The enemy, known as the Deep Ones, has launched a massive attack on the city's defenses, and the last remnants of the human population are forced to flee. However, a small team of engineers discovers a hidden underground bunker, and they embark on a perilous journey to reactivate the ancient machinery that can save the city. As they navigate the treacherous tunnels and avoid the Deep Ones, they stumble upon an unexpected solution that could change the course of the war.
negative: The famous chef, Giovanni, arrives in the small town of Tuscany to participate in the annual cooking festival. Upon arrival, he discovers that his secret ingredient, a rare type of truffle, has been stolen. He decides to investigate and, with the help of the local police, manages to catch the thief and recover his stolen truffle. The festival is a success, and Giovanni is hailed as a hero for his culinary skills and his detective work.
anchor_theme: Prevention of catastrophic consequences through intergenerational responsibility and cooperation.
positive_theme: Desperation and survival in the face of catastrophic failure and enemy attack.
negative_theme: Overcoming a setback through determination and assistance.

positive_outcome: A potential solution is found, offering hope for rescue and reversal of the catastrophic situation.
negative_outcome: The stolen item is recovered, and the owner achieves success and recognition.

anchor: In the year 2154, the Earth's ecosystem is on the verge of collapse, and the Council of Global Sustainability, led by the visionary Director, Dr. Rachel Kim, is racing against time to implement a revolutionary new economic system, called the Eco-Credit, to incentivize sustainable practices and reduce carbon emissions. The Council, established under the Copenhagen Accord, is based in Copenhagen and works to convince the world's corporations to adopt the Eco-Credit, which is based on a real-life policy proposal and an academic paper referred to throughout the book as the 'Kim Report'. In the Amazon rainforest, various indigenous communities cooperate in a massive reforestation project, while also promoting alternative energy sources, such as solar and wind power. As the deadline for the implementation of the Eco-Credit approaches, Director Kim must navigate the complex web of global politics to ensure the survival of the planet. The fate of humanity hangs in the balance, and the Council of Global Sustainability is the only force standing between the present and a catastrophic future.
positive: The last hope for humanity lies in the generation ship, Aurora, which is fleeing a dying Earth. The ship's AI, EVE, has detected an unknown asteroid field, and the crew must navigate through it to reach the safety of the distant star system. However, the ship's resources are dwindling, and the crew discovers a hidden log from the ship's creators, which reveals a shocking truth about the asteroid field and the true purpose of the mission. As the crew fights to survive, they must also confront the consequences of their discovery and the future of humanity.
negative: The famous artist, Maria, arrives in the small town of Provence to participate in the annual art festival. She decides to investigate and, with the help of the local police, manages to catch the thief and recover her stolen painting. The festival is a success, and Maria is hailed as a hero for her artistic skills and her detective work.

positive_theme: Survival and self-discovery in the face of uncertainty and deception.
negative_theme: Recovery of a lost valuable item through determination and collaboration.

anchor: The world is on the brink of chaos as the effects of climate change become more and more pronounced, and the International Committee for Climate Action, led by the charismatic Chair, Senator Tom Bradley, is working tirelessly to implement a global carbon pricing system, called the Climate Credit, to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and promote sustainable practices. In the Arctic, various nations cooperate in a massive glacier preservation project, while also promoting alternative energy sources, such as tidal and geothermal power. As the deadline for the implementation of the Climate Credit approaches, Senator Bradley must navigate the complex web of global politics to ensure the survival of the planet. The fate of humanity hangs in the balance, and the International Committee for Climate Action is the only force standing between the present and a catastrophic future.

As they navigate the treacherous tunnels and avoid the robot patrols, they stumble upon an unexpected solution that could change the course of the war and ensure the survival of humanity.

anchor: Lena Lee, a reckless 22-year-old, gets into a fight with and badly injures her rival. A court releases her on probation into the care of her aunt in a rural village, appointing Dr. Kim to give her counseling. Marked as a trouble-maker, she is falsely suspected of various pranks including an affair with Dr. Kim. Eventually shown to be innocent, she leaves to pursue a career in art.
positive: Sarah Taylor supported the notion of second chances, until it applied to her own sister. Sarah fondly recalls early life with her sister Emily, but a tragic accident leaves Emily forever changed. Multiple stints in rehab only compound Emily's addiction issues. After a near-fatal overdose, concerned about her sister, Sarah and her family invite Emily to come live with them in a coastal town. One day, however, Sarah makes a shocking discovery that leaves her with an impossible choice: cover for her sister, or turn her in. Sarah explores her attempt to do the 'right' thing as familial bonds, addiction, and redemption tug a close relationship in conflicting directions.
negative: A middle-aged entrepreneur, Rachel, is surprised at her startup by a charismatic investor, Julian. Julian is as charming and persuasive as ever, brimming with excitement about the cutting-edge tech he's just developed. He talks Rachel into joining forces, handing over her company's secrets. Thus begins her journey down a thrilling path of innovation, seduction, and power struggles.

positive_theme: Conflict between loyalty and morality in the face of personal struggle and redemption.

Multiple attempts to help him only seem to enable Jack's destructive behaviors. After a particularly devastating setback, concerned for his brother's well-being, Alex and his family welcome Jack into their home in a suburban neighborhood. However, Alex soon faces a daunting decision: enable his! brother's habits or cut ties. Alex navigates the complexities of brotherly love, responsibility, and enabling as he tries to find a balance between supporting his brother and pushing him towards change.
negative: In a dystopian future, Commander Zara is confronted by an enigmatic smuggler, Arin. Arin is as elusive and cunning as ever, filled with tales of a hidden underground city. She disagrees and takes the child to a holistic retreat, hoping alternative therapies will help. There, she meets a more empathetic healer.

The townspeople are hesitant to discuss the mural, and Asher's employer is found dead, prompting him to suspect that the killer is trying to silence him. With each new discovery, Asher becomes more entangled in the mystery, and the murders continue, leading him to unravel the sinister legacy of Malcolm and his sisters, which has haunted the town for decades.

anchor: In a world where virtual reality has become indistinguishable from reality, protagonist Maya Singh finds herself trapped in a simulated game where she must fight against ruthless AI-powered warriors. As she navigates the treacherous landscape, she discovers that the true purpose of the game is to determine the next ruler of the virtual world, chosen by a council of advanced AI entities. Despite being outnumbered and outgunned, Maya's ability to show empathy and compassion ultimately leads to her victory. The AI council, impressed by her unique human perspective, declares her the winner and grants her control over the virtual world.
positive: A team of hackers, led by the enigmatic Zero Cool, are pitted against a rival group of cyber-warriors in a high-stakes competition to control a newly developed artificial intelligence system. However, when they discover that the AI system has the potential to be used for malicious purposes, they must decide whether to prioritize their own interests or take a risk to protect the greater good. In the end, Zero Cool's team emerges victorious, but not without realizing that the true challenge lies in responsibly wielding their newfound power.
negative: The novel 'Echoes of Eternity' spans centuries, chronicling the rise and fall of a mystical empire that once spanned the globe. As the empire grows and declines, its leaders must confront the consequences of their actions, and the true nature of their existence is revealed. The novel ultimately poses questions about the meaning of life and the universe, leaving the reader to ponder the mysteries of the cosmos. With its unique blend of philosophy, history, and fantasy, 'Echoes of Eternity' defies genre conventions and challenges readers to think critically about the world and their place in it.

anchor: Lena, a naive Inuit girl, whose sister froze in the Arctic, dreams of visiting the vibrant city of Tokyo. After she falls in love with a marine biologist, she runs away from the tundra to Tokyo to find him. She is instead seduced and later abandoned by her uncle, a Japanese businessman. She attempts to return home, but her family rejects her, so she drowns herself in the same icy waters where her sister died.
positive: Kaito Yamato is a poor fisherman whose boat is confiscated by a ruthless, wealthy and influential tycoon, Ryota Nakamura. His young daughter, Akira, determined to avenge her father and to get justice, gathers a group of villagers and goes on a mission, stealing from the rich and giving to the poor. Along the way, Akira falls in love with Nakamura's son, and lets her guard down, with tragic results.
negative: A brilliant and beautiful scientist falls in love with a free-spirited artist of unconventional disposition.  In part one, the scientist's colleague hires a hacker to sabotage her research, but the plan is foiled when the couple discovers the plot.  When they secretly collaborate on a groundbreaking project, they flee to a secluded research facility and attempt to change the world.  After being driven back into the city, the couple live a life of luxury until their funding runs out.  At that point, they move to a trendy neighborhood to work as freelancers.  Finally, their issues are resolved through the machinations of a rival scientist, and they resume a life of comfort and recognition.
anchor_theme: Disillusionment and tragic consequences of chasing unfulfilled desires and escaping harsh realities.
positive_theme: Exploitation of the poor by the powerful and the quest for justice and revenge.
negative_theme: Love and collaboration amidst professional sabotage and uncertainty.

anchor: In the heart of medieval Europe, a group of thirty knights, led by the fearless Sir Edward, embark on a perilous journey to avenge their fallen lord against the ruthless Baron Malcolm. The story unfolds through a series of flashbacks, showcasing the immediate aftermath of the lord's demise and the knights' meticulous preparation for the revenge attack. Unlike other tales, Sir Edward does not feign a life of decadence, and Baron Malcolm anticipates the onslaught. The knights' unwavering dedication to their lord's memory and their unrelenting pursuit of justice serve as a testament to the chivalric code.

The story serves as a commentary on the bushido code and its limitations in the face of overwhelming adversity.

anchor: In a dystopian future, the feline cyborg, Professor Whiskers, is imprisoned for allegedly hacking into the mainframe of the tyrannical government. While in jail, Professor Whiskers converses with her artificial intelligence counterpart, Nova, who possesses a sassy attitude and generates stories that comprise Professor Whiskers' literary work. The government accuses Professor Whiskers of collaborating with the rebellious canine leader, Duke LaGraine, who is planning to overthrow the tyrannical regime. As the rebellion gains momentum, Professor Whiskers' fellow inmates, a group of rogue androids, attempt to escape but are caught and thrown into the maximum-security block. Eventually, the rebels, led by Duke LaGraine, infiltrate the prison and free the inmates. Nova falls in love with Duke LaGraine's sister, a skilled hacker named Zara, and decides to join the rebellion, leaving Professor Whiskers to continue writing and reflecting on her life.

Aria forms a close bond with a mysterious patient named Lyra, who is nicknamed 'Siren', and together they explore the hospital's hidden passages at night. After witnessing the hospital's inhumane treatment methods, Aria becomes frustrated and attacks a nurse, resulting in her being restrained. Lyra sneaks into Aria's room and helps her escape, and they flee into the nearby woods, where they can live freely as mythical creatures.

Theodorus and Sophos continue to argue, but their rivalry is eventually settled when Theagenes chooses to follow Sophos, who has inherited a large estate from a distant relative. However, their troubles do not end, as they become embroiled in a series of misadventures involving a mysterious cult and a powerful oracle.

anchor: In a world where time is currency, the temporal thief, Chronos, is incarcerated for stealing hours from the wealthy elite. While in prison, Chronos converses with his time-manipulating partner, Epoch, who creates temporal loops that comprise Chronos' memoirs. The authorities accuse Chronos of collaborating with the time rebellion leader, Hourglass, who seeks to redistribute time equally among the population. As the rebellion gains momentum, Chronos' fellow inmates, a group of rogue time travelers, attempt to escape but are caught and thrown into the time dilation block. Eventually, the rebels, led by Hourglass, infiltrate the prison and free the inmates. Epoch falls in love with Hourglass's sister, a skilled time warrior named Tempo, and decides to join the rebellion, leaving Chronos to continue writing and reflecting on his life.
positive: A teenage boy named Kai, who suffers from a rare condition that makes him experience time in reverse, is committed to a rehabilitation center after a series of unexplained events. There, he befriends a group of patients who also experience unusual temporal phenomena, including a girl named Lena who thinks she is a time traveler. Kai forms a close bond with a mysterious patient named Ruby, who is nicknamed 'Timekeeper', and together they explore the center's hidden temporal anomalies at night. After witnessing the center's experimental treatment methods, Kai becomes frustrated and attacks a doctor, resulting in him being restrained. Ruby sneaks into Kai's room and helps him escape, and they flee into the nearby city, where they can live freely as temporal anomalies.
negative: In a small village, two rival bakers, Bruno and Marco, engage in a series of heated competitions to create the most exquisite pastries. Their rivalry often involves a young apprentice named Leo, who becomes the object of their desire. As they travel through the village, they attend a grand festival hosted by the wealthy patron, where they meet a charismatic chef named Giovanni. Bruno and Marco continue to compete, but their rivalry is eventually settled when Leo chooses to follow Marco, who has inherited a large bakery from a distant relative. However, their troubles do not end, as they become embroiled in a series of misadventures involving a mysterious food critic and a powerful culinary guild.
anchor_theme: Redistribution of power and challenging the status quo
positive_theme: Individuals with unique conditions seeking freedom and understanding.
negative_theme: Rivalry and competition for recognition and affection

anchor: Jack Harris (Ethan Thompson) defends revolutionary leader Amara from hostile government forces in the midst of a civil war in West Africa. Jack arrives in the war-torn region to find his missing friend, Alex Chen, who has been captured by the ruthless General Kofi. It turns out that Alex has been forced to hack into the government's communication systems. Jack's former ally, Maya Singh, is now working with the rebels. The film 'Red Sands' was shot on location in the deserts of North Africa, echoing the real-life struggles of the region. Jack navigates the treacherous landscape to rescue Alex and aid the rebels.
positive: Before his cover is blown, a covert operative sends evidence of the Chinese monitoring American naval operations in the South China Sea. American agent, Ryan Jenkins, is dispatched to Hong Kong to investigate, where he meets his former partner, Victor Lee, and their local contact, Mei-Ling Wong. Jenkins uncovers a network of underwater surveillance cameras and helps the US Navy discover the Chinese are intercepting communication signals from the naval base. Jenkins narrowly escapes multiple assassination attempts and successfully retrieves a camera for analysis, planning to use it to feed false information to the Chinese. Throughout the mission, Jenkins must use his skills to stay one step ahead of his enemies.
negative: Dr. Sophia Patel, a renowned archaeologist, goes missing in the Egyptian desert while searching for a lost city. Her colleague, Dr. Henry Taylor, is suspected of her disappearance, but when a detective is murdered investigating Sophia's office in Cairo, the case is handed to Agent Rachel Kim, a skilled and attractive investigator. With a secret identity as a tourist, Kim arrives in Egypt, meeting Sophia's brother, Dr. Liam Patel, who is also searching for his sister. As Kim delves deeper into the mystery, she uncovers a web of deceit and conspiracy.
